intro: Psychotria grandicarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the Amazon basin. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous small, black seeds. Psychotria grandicarpa is often found in humid, shaded environments within lowland rainforests.
